node.title: The U.K. approves Merck’s molnupiravir, making it the first pill to be endorsed for treating Covid.
node.alt: Merck’s molnupiravir pills. Clinical trial data has suggested that the drug is most effective when taken during the early stages of infection.
node.description: The British authorities said that the antiviral drug was “safe and effective” in reducing the risk of hospitalization and death for those at increased risk of severe symptoms.
node.content: ["Britain on Thursday approved the antiviral drug molnupiravir for treating the coronavirus, making it the first pill to be endorsed for Covid patients. The country\u2019s regulatory body said that the antiviral pill, originally designed to fight the flu, was \u201csafe and effective\u201d in reducing the risk of hospitalization and death for those at increased risk of severe symptoms, according to a statement.", "The decision was made after a \u201crigorous review\u201d of its \u201csafety, quality and effectiveness,\u201d according to the statement from the regulatory body, the Medicines and Healthcare Products Regulatory Agency.", "Clinical trial data has suggested that the pill is most effective when taken during the early stages of infection.", "Sajid Javid, the British health secretary, described the approval as a \u201chistoric day\u201d for his country. \u201cThis will be a game changer for the most vulnerable and the immunosuppressed, who will soon be able to receive the groundbreaking treatment,\u201d he said."]
